reporting-org.narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands

title.narrative: PRE Educat. & Lifeskills for Young girls

description.narrative: The aim of the 1 year project is to offer life skills support and an education support program to 30 young women and boys residing in the informal section of Alexandra township, called Sitjwetla and 200 adolescents residing in Alexandra township. There are socio-economic challenges which plague this community, an informal settlement, such as poor water and sanitation, limited opportunities for further education at tertiary institutions, high levels of poverty and inequality and a high risk of young women and girls falling victim to gender-based violence and susceptible to contracting HIV and AIDS with poor quality public services to address these socio-economic challenges. The realization of socio-economic rights as outlined in the Constitution of South Africa is difficult, with many barriers noted in this document, which impede the ability of young women and girls to reach their full potential and enjoy equal rights. Access to education is gendered and continues to be racialized and linked to class negatively impacting on girls and young women in areas such Alexandra. The three core project goals are outlined as follows: 1. Education and life-long learning of registered girls and young womyn in Alexandra Township 2. Self-love, Self-respect and Community Activism Advocacy and awareness implemented in Alexandra Township 3. Outreach with Self-love, Self-respect and Community activism across Gauteng. A few of the objectives linked to the goals include: • To develop a support program for School Readiness 2 • To facilitate additional learning resources for registered girls and young women • To provide Life Skills sessions to girls and young women in Alexandra Township • To develop a Training of Trainers (TOT) course on the NF model of Self-love, Self-Respect and Community Activism • To facilitate three (3) TOT by December 2020 • To launch Trainers at a formal graduation in January 2021 • To conduct mid-term evaluation of the project • To document the project model • To facilitate partnerships with various organizations supporting ideals of NF
